intro: Dichapetalum rabiense, commonly known as the Rabiense mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
